availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick Henry Skinner (Eddyville, Kentucky, attorney and judge)

body.p: Eddyville, Lyon County, Kentucky, hotel keeper, attorney and judge. Caldwell County, Kentucky, native. Married Helen M. Catlett Skinner in Caldwell County on July 26, 1843. Father of Thomas C. Skinner, Isabella Skinner, Aurelia Skinner, Marian Skinner, Helen M. Skinner, Giles L. Skinner, and Hylan Skinner. Guardian of Hylan Benton Lyon. Hotel keeper in Caldwell County in 1850. Owned twenty enslaved persons in 1850. Member of the Masonic Order in Kentucky at Suwanee Lodge #190, in Eddyville, in 1860. Presiding Judge of the Lyon County Court from 1860 to 1863. Owned ten enslaved persons in 1860. Enslaved an additional ten persons as agent for Hylan B. Lyon in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000851644, p. 305.
